title: VF Corp. Chairman and CEO Steven Rendle Retires; Apparel maker taps former Clorox chief as interim leader as it cuts 2023 guidance
text:
Mr. Dorer served as CEO of Clorox from 2014 until 2020 after a decade at the household staple product maker and 15 years at consumer-goods giant Procter & Gamble Co.

VF said Mr. Rendle's departure was by mutual agreement with the board. The company said Richard Carucci, a board member since 2009, will serve as interim chairman.

The shakeup at the top of VF comes as the company lowered its fiscal 2023 sales and earnings guidance, citing weaker-than-expected consumer demand across its categories, primarily in North America.

VF said the weak demand has resulted in an elevated promotional environment and order cancellations in the wholesale channel to manage trade inventories.

The company said it now expects full-year adjusted per-share earnings of $2 to $2.20, down from a prior forecast of $2.40 to $2.50, and full-year constant-dollar sales growth of 3% to 4%, compared with prior guidance for a rise of 5% to 6%.

Analysts polled by FactSet, on average, were expecting VF to post fiscal 2023 adjusted earnings of $2.41 a share.

VF shares fell 11% to $29.51 on Monday. They are down 60% this year.

Write to Colin Kellaher at colin.kellaher@wsj.com

VF Corp. Chairman and CEO Steven Rendle Retires
